p: MAYV was first isolated in 1954 in Trinidad and Tobago and has since been reported in Central and South America, circulating through high-density tropical forests ( 1, 4, 8, 14- 37). A total of 901 MAYV cases have been reported in 10 Latin American countries and 1 Caribbean country. Of these 901 cases, 843 autochthonous and 16 imported cases were reported in academic literature, and the remaining 42 cases were exclusively reported by health authorities ( 1, 4, 8, 14- 37). Given the extent of arboviral diseases in Latin America and the Caribbean, MAYV may pose a similar public health threat in the area.
